topic.title: Creating a website with zeronet.py not working on linux, the documentation here and on readthedocs are wrong
topic.body:
Hi,

The docs says to use **zeronet.py** when, on linux at least, the ZeroNet.sh does the job while the core/zeronet.py doesn't run on it's own or with `python3 zeronet.py`. I kinda spent 10 minutes figuring out that zeronet.py was not the way.

To create a website I just had to:
`**./ZeroNet.sh siteCreate**
- Starting ZeroNet...
- Libsecpk256k1 loaded: CompiledLib in 0.070s
- Version: 0.7.1 r4206, Python 3.7.3 (default, Mar 27 2019, 22:11:17) 
[GCC 7.3.0], Gevent: 1.4.0
- Generating new privatekey...
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------
- Site private key: 5KJj8dqBGkz7vpc8paerSt14LRVjEfDqsfA2zRVDU3rj6ygCRTiU
-                   !!! ^ Save it now, required to modify the site ^ !!!
- Site address:     1NiuEyRbabY1ZzjbF3UAGsFdQMXzasd6Lz
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------
? Have you secured your private key? (yes, no) > `

Here are the instances I found of where it ought to be explained:
https://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/using_zeronet/create_new_site/
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet#how-can-i-create-a-zeronet-site

1604067723_mirrored_nazmifr_github.body:
> What is your problem? I running on GNU/Linux too and I don't get it what is the problem.
> Don't say that is not working in GNU/Linux because that is completely false. I can confirm at least that.

Hi,
Indeed I wasn't explicit enough, should have mentioned I was using this version. Anyways, that was the documentation that was the issue (in my opinion) thanks for having fixed it so that others won't have a hard time creating a site. 

And thanks for this awesome project and active community
